Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Newnew29
Reviews.Content: This hotel is literally 100m from the Vatican. We were upgraded to a superior room with a huge bathroom. Couldn't have been better. There is some street noise if you leave your window open. The staff was very friendly and helped anyway they could. If you are debating on whether or not to book this hotel, do it now. You won't regret it! It's only an 10 euro cab ride to colosseum.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SimonWoodbridge
Reviews.Content: We just spent 4 nights with the Vatican View. We are a family of four so we booked two rooms. The hotel was just what we wanted. We prefer to eat out for breakfast and dinner, so we dont need all the usual hotel trimmings. All we need is a comfortable clean bed with decent bathroom. The Vatican View has all that plus. We thought it was superb value in such a good location. The Borgo Pio is just round the corner which has plenty of good Trattatorias, Cafe's and even religious shops. Need to make an extra mention for the concierge/office manager Fabio who was so friendly and helpful. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in Rome!!”
Reviews.Author: USAtraveler2013
Reviews.Content: I just left Rome and stayed at this hotel. It was literally less than 100 yards from the Vatican. Shopping was a couple blocks down the street for boutiques and a grocery store. A couple quaint cafes are nearby- I recommend going to the one across from the Vatican wall just across the street and to the left. Rooms were nice- all have a hair dryer, lots of hanging space and drawers with modern bathrooms. We stayed in Room 102 that did not have a fridge in the room but had one just outside the door with a stove and cabinets full of dishes we could use. Fabio at the front desk was very accommodating. He was able to get us a van on the last day to take us to the airport. He furnished us with a simple map and gave recommendations for shopping & dining. Clean towels, 2 waters, and croissants were provided everyday (specify still water or soda water). We did not have a/c (not a/c season yet) and had to keep the windows. It was comfortable but hard to sleep with the city noise. The upstairs terrace was wonderful and furnished with outdoor patio furniture sets. Will stay here the next time I go to Rome and recommend to all who want a great central location that is clean!!

Reviews.Title: “Three day visit for 6 Nations Rugby”
Reviews.Author: hamejane
Reviews.Content: Superb visit. Really a suite with twin beds - bathroom and kitchen area. Spacious with excellent design features in furnishing. Very helpful staff and superb roof terrace with genuine views to St Peters Square etc. We booked early and thought 370 Euros for 3 nights to be very good value. Transport to anywhere in the city is first class. We will return!! Hamish Wilkie Bath UK

Reviews.Title: “Hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: x3non
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated in a very good location which helps you to visit Vatican, Sixteen Chapel and many other nice places. The rooms are smaller than how they look like in presentation, but still nice and clean. The hotel has a wonderful terrace on the roof where you can enjoy the view and the wine.....

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, apartment style hotel in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: Constanze_M
Reviews.Content: The Vatican View is, as you would expect, a stone's throw from the Vatican and in a perfect location for exploring the city. It was also well located for my business meetings in the Prati district and for the restaurants and nightlife of Trastevere. The hotel appears to be a recently refurbished apartment building and has kitchenettes on each floor and a roof terrace at the top. Our room was lovely - very spacious with plenty of storage space, and beautiful, if quirky, furnishings. It was roasting hot during our stay but the room stayed nice and cool and we had a lovely view of the bussling street life from our large, white shuttered windows. The bathroom was very small, but had modern fittings and a good shower. The hotel does not have a restaurant or bar, the reception is in the next door building and guests are given keys to the building in which the rooms are situated. The advantage of this is that you can come and go as you please, even late at night. There is no breakfast, but the rooms have tea and coffee making facilities and mineral water, biscuits and croissants are provided free of charge. In many ways, the set up is similar to an "apart-hotel". I do think that the Vatican View could make more of this, perhaps by providing more extensive facilities for guests to prepare their own breakfasts and by installing mini-bars in the rooms. I also think that the roof terrace is something of a missed opportunity - in-room mini bars or a small roof-top bar (even an honesty bar) would be nice. All in all, perfect for a romantic weekend break in Rome, but maybe not ideal for business travellers.

Reviews.Title: “Expectations met, and more!”
Reviews.Author: RustyRazor
Reviews.Content: From my initial email exchanges with the front desk via email after I'd made the reservation (inquired re. wi-fi, etc.) to the check-out after my two-day stay, I was fully satisfied, and more. More, because of the location--Vatican View is on a very good street two minutes from Piazza San Pietro, and it's a 15 minute walk to Navona. The dining in the neighborhood is a bit pricy in some places, but good food :) My room was very spacious, modern, and had good window (actually opened) and light. Bathroom modern, clean, everything you'd expect from a great hotel. The management was extremely helpful (fluent English and Italian, of course). Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great location ... friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Gerry B
Reviews.Content: Hotel Vatican View ... very clean, great location and friendly staff. Great value !!!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Service”
Reviews.Author: Simm0ns_Family
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Vatican View for one night upon returning back to Rome from a 3 day tour. Thanks to industrial action within AirFrance, we did not get to spend as long at the hotel as originally planned This establishment is marketed as a hotel but in fact the rooms and service offering are more akin to an apartment – higher standard of fitout in the building, private entrance without going through a reception area, rooms which are more comfortable to stay in etc The overall feel of the hotel is very modern but with some pleasant touches of the original building remaining (very high ceilings for example). The renovation must be very recent as everything looked very new and clean. We found the rooms to be very comfortable. The bathrooms are large and nicely appointed. The beds at first felt quite firm but proved to be very comfortable. The bedrooms are a little on the small side but the overall design of the rooms is well thought out to make the best use of the available space. The service we received was first rate. We arrived for check in 1 hour after the office officially closed. This was no issue and we received a cheerful greeting despite the inconvenience caused for the manager. He was also extremely helpful in booking us a taxi to catch an early morning flight It is interesting to have read so many reviews about the location. It is certainly true that it would be hard to find a location with better proximity to the Vatican. Further, the location is quite a convenient base in which to explore the city. For shopaholics there is excellent shopping available several streets away. During our holiday in Rome we also spent some time based in an apartment near Campo De' Fiori. Comparing the two locations we felt that the later location was more family orientated, offered a better range of restaurants and never ceased to throw up interesting surprises as we explored the multitude of back streets away form the more touristy parts of the city. Obviously very much a case of personal preference

Reviews.Title: “Did not honor web site commitment”
Reviews.Author: D B
Reviews.Content: 2010 girlfriend & I stayed there, they did not honor a free night per their web site; no free airport shuttle, no buffet breakfast (there was no room), did not have separate beds that were promised; nor was there any free chocolate or bottle of olive oil that was also promised via their web site. My friend & I had to sleep in the same bed in a room we could barely move around in; we had to buy our own breakfast & coffee and everything else. We would not have expected it if they had not said they offered it. Thank god we were both small women, we kept hitting our elbows on the faucets in the shower because it was so small. The room was never cleaned, toilet seat had feces on it 2 days in a row, not sure how it got on the seats since women sit down & look first before sitting. We tried to keep our towels separate so we did not have to use each others because they were never changed. The location was the only plus as it was close to the Vatican. But several nights we could not sleep because of the street noise out side our one window. There were several dumpsters outside our window as well and the garbage truck was so loud and took so long to empty all those dumpsters that we did not sleep much at all. All in all I loved Italy, just not Vatican View; I would not recommend it to anyone that expects their web offers to be real and the hotel to honor any of them.

Reviews.Title: “Nice boutique hotel - no frills - nice room.”
Reviews.Author: VooDooTravelPro
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 3 nights here. There is a lovely roof terrace that you can bring your own food and drinks to - and enjoy the evening. Hotel is half a block from Vatican. The reception people were super friendly and helpful. There is no lobby and no other facilities - just room and a roof terrace. But that is all we needed.

Reviews.Title: “Small, clean, friendly and near the Vatican, and PARKING”
Reviews.Author: Shelley A
Reviews.Content: Although they say the desk is only open til 9, we didn't arrive until 1AM and had to rouse the manager by buzzer. It was no problem and the room was beautiful, the bed comfortable and the bathroom was spotless. A small hotel, not mobbed with people we were very happy there and would certainly stay again when we return to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely little gem”
Reviews.Author: kkbirds
Reviews.Content: Fantastic experience at this little boutique hotel near the Vatican. I stayed two nights on a business trip and everything went smoothly. From check-in (so friendly! and they helped to orientate the hotel for me on a map), to the mini-tour the manager gave me of my room, to helping me hail a cab each morning, to check-out. The staff were really my favorite part, they were such a joy :) Rooms are a bit on the small side, but great modern bathroom and powerful shower. Comfy pillows. Coffee/tea maker, but only a few snacks for food (no full restaurant). Which really doesn't matter as you're in Rome and the cafes nearby are numerous and waiting... Overall, great stay. I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly & accomodating!”
Reviews.Author: cheryl105
Reviews.Content: We just returned from staying at vatican view. Our holiday began with 4 days in Rome...the 5th day we were to travel to Tuscany to stay in a rented villa...however my husband was hit by a car crossing the road near the termini...he was in hospital/surgery for 6 days...when he was released we moved to vatican views...we were so pleased and comfortable in our corner view room...Fabio and staff were so helpful...from finding a travel agent to re book flight home...to suggesting dinner locations...always friendly...the rooms were updated..spacious and so comfortable and clean...rooftop certainly was a bonus space for my husband to recooperate! They certainly made the last 5 days of our horrifying holiday much better...hoping to return and will certainly advise my friends to stay here!!! Thanks again so much xo

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: Elise M
Reviews.Content: My husband and I really enjoyed our stay at Vatican View. The location is wonderful and the staff is very helpful (special thanks to Fabio, we loved your cappuccino!). The hotel is clean and comfortable, our room was spacious and well decorated and the bathroom was huge... We will definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “5 days i lovely Rome.”
Reviews.Author: AllanLund
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located right by St. Peter's Square. There are great big rooms, with separate tee kitchen and lovely large bathroom. There is a lovely roof terrace with views to the domes of St. Peter's Basilica. There are bars and nice little restaurants within a very short radius. Close to shopping and close to bus stop for tour buses. The hotel has no restaurant, but there are plenty of dining options in your neighborhood. We picked up breakfast at a bar and ate on the rooftop in the sunrise. Fantastic. The hotel has a very pleasant and helpful staff, it is cleaned and prepared well in the rooms every day. We were very pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Immaculate Presentation, Ave.sized rooms in a great location”
Reviews.Author: WorthKnowing
Reviews.Content: We checked into Vatican Views for one night and were not disappointed. The establishment is not a hotel (does not operate a 24hr Reception Desk), nor apartments (limited in room facilities) yet is 'something' in between. Immaculate rooms, albeit of an average size, well appointed bathrooms and products and overall a modern and very clean property. Located within a 'stones throw' of the Vatican; great location. Would recommend for stays of less 3 nights or less.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot in Rome”
Reviews.Author: Bamma22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were first time travelers to Rome at the beginning of September. After doing several weeks of research we decided to book the Vatican view hotel. After spending 4 days in the best possible location for site seeing, we couldn't stop talking about our experience. 1st, even after reading reviews and seeing pictures, I was still nervous about the room size and functionality of a Italian hotel room. The room was perfect, except for the lack of dresser space, the bed was big, the closet was huge and the bathroom was better than what we expected. Very modern facilities, with hair dryer, stand up shower and even wi-fi in your room. Each night my wife and I would go site seeing in the different parts of Rome and then casually stroll back to the hotel. The Vatican is less than a 3 minute walk with great views from the upstairs terrace, and all major sites are less than 15-20 minutes from the hotel. You can easily find taxis outside the front door if you don't want to walk. The only thing I would say is that the restaurants around the hotel seem to be tourist traps. Go explore other places to eat, try cicci bomba, it was the best meal we had in all of Italy. You will not go wrong with this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “What view! fantastic”
Reviews.Author: ann_thescan
Reviews.Content: This is an ideally located hotel for a short tourist trip to Rome. Literally 50 steps has you in St Peter's Square and tourist bus stops are just around the corner. We had a suite which accomodated the four of us well- the kitchenette was welcome. All the staff were helpful and friendly - including carrying bags up staris when the lift was out of action. The roof garden is wonderful- a fantastic location to sit and unwind after sight seeing and provides and unparrallelled view across much of the city.

Reviews.Title: “We loved in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: houseH
Reviews.Content: Everything was ideally! This hotel was the one of lovely part of our staying in Rome! Good location, clean and nice equipped room. The reception staff very professional, communicable and responsive. Thanks them for all. If we ever will be in Rome again, surely come here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: SonjaUtrecht
Reviews.Content: Very luxurious and clean rooms!! Friendly and helpfull staff!! nearby the places of interest in Rome! Two steps away from the Vatican. A hotel to return to!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely hotel in a great City !!”
Reviews.Author: nevershenk
Reviews.Content: For small hotel the facilities are great and really comfortable. The staff are ALL extremely friendly and could not do enough to help us - without being asked. We did a awful lot of walking in a very hot week in Rome and the hotel was just perfect to come back to with good air conditioning and a surprise roof top terrace to chill out on. Would love to go back to Rome and when we do will check Vatican View out first. !!

Reviews.Title: “Would highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dst123
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband stayed at this hotel in March and we thought it was going to be too good to be true and that there must be a catch somewhere, but we were wonderfully surprised when we arrived to find it was exactly as the pictures showed. The staff are wonderfully helpful and friendly and the location was perfect. We literally could see the Vatican wall from our hotel window and were therefore within walking distance of all the sights we wanted to see - We didn't use public transport once while in Rome. The room was stunning, perhaps a little small, but when you're on a city break and it's just a base we didn't mind that - it more than made up for the size by the beautiful decor. The price we paid was unbelievablely low and friends who stay in Rome regularly really feared for what we would arrive to and even made me re-check the price before I left the UK as they couldn't believe the value of this hotel, especially for the location. But it turned out it was exactly as quoted and far exceeded our expectations in every way. We would definately recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT HOTEL! Thank you Alexandra!”
Reviews.Author: paki57ru
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife stayed in this hotel in May for four days. It's very beautiful! My big room was the 101, very modern and very clean with water and breakfast free. The hotel is clean and it has a beautiful roof where we went for drink wine and see the vatican and castelo angelo illuminate as alexandra say to us. The breakfast is just italian with special fabio cappucino! The only bad thing was the housekeeping, too much noise during the morning! Me and my wife were in rome for the first time and alexandra say to us where to eat, to drink in the night with a good price, no turist. She was very kind all the time. Also thank you to fabio and daniel. We will come back soon in Vatican View!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Petecollis
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Vatican View, in Nov for my girlfriends 30th birthday. The location is perfect for the Vatican,although it's a little way from the centre of Rome. It was perfect for us,as the walk every morning was just fantastic. The hotel is a little strange, but we really liked it. The rooms are small but very well designed. Would definately go back.

Reviews.Title: “Smart modern hotel, friendly & helpful staff, excellant location”
Reviews.Author: Ali-Blake
Reviews.Content: Great location at the gates of St Peter's Square, plenty of restaurants and cafe's on the door step. 5 minutes from excellant shopping and the metro link. Modern but charming room with freindly staff. Not cheap but well worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “A great location for a hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephentricker1
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel very clean, two minutes from the Vatican. The hotel is a ten minute walk from the metro,and is within easy walking distance to shops and restaurants. The staff are very friendly & helpful, we will definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “a hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: studio83
Reviews.Content: I stayed there for 2 days in Jan 2011 and I had a great time. It was a little hotel/apartment near Vatican and you can walk to Vatican basically in 2 mins. For some people it may seem a bit remote from the town centre, but I found it very convenient as I could walk to the metro around 10-15 mins and could travel around the city easily. Definitely recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great small place”
Reviews.Author: Gresz
Reviews.Content: I never had any doubt about Vatican View. And I was proved right. Its stone’s throw vicinity to the Basilica S. Pietro – makes it simply a dream come true for anybody who wants to start exploring Rome from Vatican and/or finish the day by crossing the romantic Ponte Sant’Angelo. Considering it’s so close to the treasures of the Musei Vaticani it’s a treasure itself. The hotel is indeed small but warm and comfy. A very nice bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and modern hotel 2 mins from the Vatican museum”
Reviews.Author: pablocostello
Reviews.Content: Myself and my partner stayed here on our New Years break in Rome 2010/2011 and I have to say we were very impressed overall. LOCATION: Difficult to find at first as it is not a standalone building and no big sign; just a large door on the street and a plague- clearly the hotel used to be apartments. For a young couple like ourselves, it was a perfect base to see the sites of Rome. If your primary interest is Renaissance art and sculpture, the Vatican museum is very close by. St. Peter's Basilica is a stones throw away also. The others sites of Rome, however, are across the Tiber and require a Metro (10 mins walk to nearest station) or a 20 to 30 min walk across the city- something to keep in mind for elderly, families and disabled. You could argue that you're going to want to see the Vatican anyway and on that morning, you only have to roll out of bed and you're there. HOTEL & ROOM The first thing that strikes you is the facade of the hotel. It's just a door with the "Relais Vatican View" engraved on a plague. There is a buzzer with which to identify yourself when you arrive first. It becomes clear very quickly that the hotel has recently been renovated from apartments as you make your up narrow staircases, into a tiny lift and up to reception. The greeting at reception was friendly and we arrived late. The rooms are fantastically modern and impressively clean. I've stayed in hundreds of hotels on business and never have I come across a room as clean & modern. Bed sheets changed every day no matter what time we left. Bathroom was small but again to the highest standard of cleanliness. PRICE Probably the best part for us. We booked six months in advance and got 4 nights for just over 200 euro. Incredible when you think one of those nights was NYE. OTHER BONUSES Free Wifi- an absolute godsend. Got a lovely card left in our room on NYE wishing us a Happy New Year- a great touch! Pros- Impeccably clean and modern, great value, very comfortable Cons- Narrow apartment complex-like staircase, halls & lift. Location may be a problem if you like to be closer to the action. No breakfast but plenty of cafes around the corner. Overall very impressed and would definitely recommend to young couples. Paul & Joanna from Ireland

Reviews.Title: “Not recommended!”
Reviews.Author: pinacoladaLatvia
Reviews.Content: Pros: Location - 100m from Vatican, renovated rooms, very helpful and pleasant personnel Cons: No proper breakfast, non-soundproof walls (we could clearly hear what our next-door neighbors were talking about - very unhelpful early in the morning), typical small rooms, overpriced given existing quality

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Perfect, couldn’t believe our luck and Fabio was the perfect host.”
Reviews.Author: kenandmagswales
Reviews.Content: I couldn’t believe our luck in getting into such a well positioned hotel – we could actually see the Vatican from our room. Although it was small – it was quaint, modern and very comfortable. We’ve stayed at quite a few hotels and I have to say the standard was superb – spotlessly clean with crisp white sheets and fluffy white towels. The hotel does not offer breakfast but there’s a vast amount of places to choose from to eat in the locality There are coffee/tea facilities in the rooms, however Fabio (the manager) encouraged us to come up to the reception each morning if we wanted to try his cappuccino. He was pleasant, chatty and full of friendly advice – this probably being the advantage of staying at a small hotel. I wouldn’t hesitate in staying there again. - WELL RECOMMENDED.

Reviews.Title: “Priceless”
Reviews.Author: NSoa
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife we went to Rome finally!!!! We 've been planning this trip for years and it went perfect obviously thanks also to Vatican view !!! As the title says this place is priceless the bedrooms are clean and comfortable and the location is one of the best location in Rome. The hotel is right in the center of Rome just outside the Vatican City walls and at a walking distance from everything. Spanish Steps Piazza Venezia San Pietro Castel Sant' Angelo bars and clubs are just a few steps from the hotel. The receptionist guy was an angel we didn't know much about the area and he helped us with everything from concerts to shopping he was really amazing... Daniel Grazie ;) I sincerely recommend the Vatican View Hotel***** :) See you soon !!!!!! Nick&Marla <3

Reviews.Title: “Room canceled 2 days before stay and downgrade”
Reviews.Author: JulieandJeremy
Reviews.Content: We've booked a stay at Vatican View some weeks in Nov on a crowded week-end. They contacted us 2 days in advance to mention there were works in the aisle where our room was located and proposed us a supposedly equivalent hotel that was available on the internet for a price inferior by 40%: it was a clear downgrade. No works were performed there at all at Vatican View, but there were undoubtedly other rooms available on the same site via which we booked, same level as ours, but 2 to 3 times the price we paid. Such behaviour from an hotel is unacceptable, hence I would never recommend such hotel. To get the same level 2 days in advance cost us double the price (...). So my conclusion is: might be a good place to stay, to be avoided during peak periods since can't be trusted. Now you can't say you didn't know. NOTE THAT LOWEST RATING CONCERNS THIS STORY: WE CAN'T JUDGE FOR WHAT'S INSIDE SINCE WE DID NOT STAY THERE.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel , few small issues”
Reviews.Author: chrisking1234
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 5 days at the Vatican view. So ..... firstly ..... no view of the vatican but yes it is incredibly close and i mean about a 30 sec walk until you are in st peters square. This is great except there isnt much else around the immediate area apart from the vatican. The location is good but you will either need to walk for about 25 mins to get to the main city area or a ten min walk and then a cheap metro instead. Not a major issue but it might be for elderly couples or parents. The hotel itself is very hard to find , just a black door and a tiny sign !! Very small lift and a tight staircase to reception on the 4th floor (while they have some issues sorted). Staff are all very friendly and helpful though. Room was a good size , comfy bed , big tv but only bbc world news in english. Bathroom is lovely but very small. No breakfast available but there is a little kitchen area and lots of cafes nearby. This is a brand new hotel so its going to have a few teething problems but all in all its a lovely little place and for just over 300 euros for 4 nights its a steal !!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Smemma
Reviews.Content: My mother and I stayed in this new hotel for two nights. I previously worked in Rome so was familiar with the area however I didn't realise quite how near it was to the vatican. The location is perfect as its at the vatican but 5 minutes from the metro station that'll bring you right into the hustle and bustle of the centre of Rome. The hotel itself is a lovely small boutique hotel however the room we had we really big, room 301- twin beds by request. The decor is particularly elegant and refined whilst also being very comfortable. Its a charming blend of modern decor in a period building. The staff at the hotel were all excellent, in particular Fabio who was extremely accommodating of my request for twin beds. Overall I would say this new hotel is a refreshing addition to the Roman hotel market, beautiful large and tastefully decorated room in a perfect location for €134 a night- brilliant

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choise”
Reviews.Author: crusoe2212
Reviews.Content: We made a citytrip for 3 days and chose this hotel. It proved a right choise. Very nice room (and bathroom), very close to the vatican and very friendly staff. It is a small hotel (only 15 rooms). There is no option for breakfast but we did't find that any problem because there are plenty of good options for breakfast in the neighberhood.

Reviews.Title: “This No Frills Reasonably Priced Hotel Is An Outstanding Value”
Reviews.Author: Annie102
Reviews.Content: Vatican View Hotel really is at the back door of the Vatican, surrounded by restaurants. It is a small hotel which does not have a facility for offering breakfast or many amenities, but it makes up for this by being beautifully designed, well decorated with spotlessly clean and efficient bathroom and a comfortable bed. Lighting is excellent It was just what we needed and I would definitely return when in Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Choice for Rome”
Reviews.Author: anonymous6575
Reviews.Content: I really liked this place. It's just a few steps away from St. Peter's Basilica. The rooms are beautifully furnished in a modern designer style and do actually look like in the pictures you'll find in the internet. Also, the young lady at the reception was nice and charming. The hotel does not have a restaurant or breakfast room and no minibar. Also, the rooms are not very sound proof. However, all of this didn't mather too much to me. I would book this hotel again ...

Reviews.Title: “Elegant little gem right at the Vatican”
Reviews.Author: mvrensing
Reviews.Content: We found this super new hotel by incident on Google maps, as it opened only 15 day ago. The hotel is about 100m from the Vatican and 300 meters from all (tourist) bus stations. Very modern design, very quiet en equipped with free WIFI, Samsung LED TV, rain shower, and with a nice balcony with a view on the rooftop. Our room was quite small, but well equipped with a coffee maker, some snacks and a small kitchen in the hallway.They offer no breakfast, but there are plenty opportunities around. Parking on the street is nearly impossible but they sent us to a parking garage 100m away where we could safely keep the car. If you look for an elegant, brand new small design hotel near the Vatican, this is it. We are certain that this hotel will hit the top 30 in Rome on Trip Advisor soon!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: anne_cv
Reviews.Content: The room was beautiful, very nice bathroom, and the people are very nice. Special thanks to Fabio. Annemarie

Reviews.Title: “Modern, clean, perfect location, 100mtrs from the Vatican!”
Reviews.Author: SwissieZurich
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel to spend a weekend as extended family together. We booked 2 rooms. Very new, well furnished with modern appliances and access to kitchen facilities either within room or corridor. Rooms had air-con which was a bonus and could be controlled in each room. Very nice welcome from Fabio. No restaurant or breakfast available but we just bought in and plenty of cafes close by. Very quiet location but only a few steps to St. Peters Square. Bed slightly hard but fine. In one room we had a large sofa bed which allowed for extra space during the day but needed making up at night. If you are looking for something modern, clean with a nice design I would not hesitate to reserve here, you have easy access to other areas of Rome with the nearby tourist buses around town. Only slight irritation was we could hear the people in the next room but this only disturbed us for an hour one evening. Highly recommend in a city where many hotels are in need of renovation!

HotelInfo.Name: Vatican View
HotelInfo.Address: Via del Mascherino, 34, 00193 Rome, Italy
